resources.string: All information in this list from wikiPedia

string-array.name: historical_declaration
string-array.item: The Egyptian pyramids are ancient pyramid-shaped masonry structures located in Egypt

Abdeen Palace (Arabic: قصر عابدين\u200E\u200E) is a historic Cairo palace, and one of the official residences and the principal workplace of the President of Egypt, located above Qasr el-Nil Street in eastern Downtown Cairo, Egypt

Abydos is one of the oldest cities of ancient Egypt, and also of the eighth nome in Upper Egypt, of which it was the capital city. It is located about 11 kilometers (6.8 miles) west of the Nile at latitude 26 ° 10 N, near the modern Egyptian towns of el-Araba el Madfuna and al-Balyana. In the ancient Egyptian language, the city was called Abdju (bdw or AbDw). The English name Abydos comes from the Greek Ἄβυοο,, a name borrowed by Greek geographers from the unrelated city of Abydos on the Hellespont
